column5: Hit up a somewhat local fishing hole that has produced in the past... Today was not that day...  5 hours+ of fishing... 1 fish lol and not the target species... Ahhh well it was a good day out regardless spending some time with a good lifelong friend.  For those of you that don't know Glen Ross is located on the Trent just below lock #7  I didn't take too many pics well only one really.  Anyways here is the one measly fish for the day. Hopefully you guys did better then we did.  We tried everything.... And this sucker hit a 1/8oz jig tip with a small minnow.... Go figure..    G
Pound fer pound we were about tied for the day.... although I'll take an inland rainbown anyday over a pike haha.  Looks like you managed to stay warmer than I did
Beats staying in. Looks like an eater, did you put the blade to it?
It would have been the perfect size for the table. However I let swim.  G
I've stopped at the old railway bridge there a few times and washed some lures. It looks so inviting, but I've never had so much as a hint of a suggestion of a nibble.
Nice pike Gerritt, better than nothing right
Been down there in the boat lots of pike and channel cats. better than the skunkingni got on kemp
Yup we sure did.... Thanks to this.    A buddie from work keeps his hut there and has yet to use it this year.... We put it on the ice and made a couple holes.... Hotter then hades in the hut.
Dave Bailey, sent you a PM  G
This is true.... Sucks for the buddy I brought with me though lol
